messages.content: Simon Hughes always puts our area first.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Simon is fighting to change the law to make it easier for councils and housing associations to do up local homes.
Simon fights hard to protect local services like health, heart surgery, faculties and oppose cuts, helped save Guy's Hospital.

Simon provides over 5000 people with help and advice every year. He is involved in every aspect of local people's lives and works hard to provide new opportunities for young people, homes for young people.
Fought for international schools and justice. He pushed Liberal Democrat campaign for urgent climate action.

mentions.candidate: Simon Hughes has earned his reputation as a hardworking local champion.

leaflet.personalStatement: Simon has lived on Lynton Road for 27 years. He has never claimed a penny for his home and receives the same local services as everyone else in our area.

politicalExperience.role: MP for Bermondsey and Old Southwark
politicalExperience.achievements: He has worked on issues from fighting to save local health services, to helping local residents with their problems, to standing up to Labour closing hospitals, to campaigning for new schools.

leaflet.additionalNotes: Simon Hughes has been opposed by the Conservatives who are complicit in letting Labour closing hospitals and stop Labour's disastrous home information packs. Simon Hughes is fighting to have all new secondary schools in Walworth and Rotherhithe, and nationally to cut class sizes for 5-7 year olds.
